questions.text: An old woman, Nanda suffered a stroke for which she was given alteplase. She improved considerably. To prevent the recurrence of stroke, this patient is most likely to be treated indefinitely with :
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Aspirin

Highyeild:

Aspirin Contraindications: Allergy or hypersensitivity to salicylates (aspirin, wintergreen) GI Bleeding Active ulcer disease Hemorrhagic stroke Bleeding disorders Children with cold and flu-like symptoms Drug Interactions: Decreased effects with antacids and steroids. Special Considerations: Pregnancy Category D, not to be used in pregnant women,Pregnancy Category D, not to be used in pregnant women, Antiplatelet drugs like aspirin or clopidogrel are used to prevent arterial thrombosis ( in diseases like IM and stroke) Enoxaparin ( LMW Heparin) is an indirect thrombin inhibitor used in the treatment of DVT. Urokinase is a fibrinolytic drug used in stroke/acute MI/ pulmonary embolism ( within 3-4 hrs) Warfarin is an oral anticoagulant and vit K inhibitor.

questions.text: Mohan, a 67- year old male comes to the physician’s office complaining of severe pain in the right foot with paleness of the right toe. The patient had a history of receiving unfractionated heparin 7 days back. The hemogram of the patient is as shown: Hb 13.2 g/dl WBC 10000/mm3 Platelet 50000/mm3 Which of the following should be used to treat this condition?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Argatroban

Highyeild:

Heparin induced thrombocytopenia( HIT) Four ‘T’ in the diagnosis of HIT: Venous thrombosis- most common presentation Thrombocytopenia Thinning of heparin administration ( 5-14 DAYS) before developing thrombocytopenia. Other causes of thrombocytopenia are not evident. Discontinue heparin immediately and LMWH should be avoided. DOC for HIT is direct thrombin inhibitors like argatroban. Lepirudin can be used as an alternative. Thrombosis is present, which leads to the consumption of protein C, so giving warfarin to the patient would further decrease protein c levels and cause skin necrosis. Therefore warfarin is avoided in such patients.

questions.text: An old lady came with a complaint of pain in the left calf region. A diagnosis of deep vein thrombosis( DVT) was made and she was put on warfarin therapy. After 3 months, she was brought to the hospital with a complaint of nose bleed which automatically stopped in a few minutes. Her lab reports show an INR of 7. To avoid hemorrhage, what to do next in addition to discontinuation of the drug?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Vitamin K1

Highyeild:

K acts as a cofactor in the synthesis of clotting factors II, VII, IX, and X by the liver. Warfarin works as an anticoagulant by inhibiting vitamin K episode reductase( VKOR) in the liver. Inhibition of VKOR decreases the synthesis of clotting factors. Overdose of warfarin can result in bleeding. Hematuria is usually the first to occur. Other common sites of bleeding are GIT Nose Under the skin ecchymosis Excessive anticoagulant effect and bleeding from warfarin can be prevented by stopping the drug and administering oral or parenteral vitamin K1( Phytonatidine) Acute bleeding can be treated by a four-factor complex or fresh-frozen plasma.

In hemophilia A and von Willebrand disease, it should only be used for mild to moderate cases. Option: C. Factor VIII (FVIII) is an essential blood-clotting protein, also known as an anti-hemophilic factor (AHF). In humans, factor VIII is encoded by the F8 gene. Defects in this gene result in hemophilia A , a recessive X-linked coagulation disorder. Factor VIII is produced in liver sinusoidal cells and endothelial cells . Option: D.Protamine is a medication used to reverse and neutralize the anticoagulant effects of heparin . Protamine is the specific antagonist that neutralizes heparin-induced anticoagulation.

questions.text: Which drug is metabolized primarily by CYP 2C19?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Clopidogrel

Highyeild:

CLOPIDOGREL Widely used in stroke prevention, 75 mg once daily is the standard dose, It may take 4-5 days for the antiplatelet activity of clopidogrel to show full effects, A loading dose of 300 mg of clopidogrel may be given at the time of starting it, 12% people may not respond to clopidogrel therapy due to the presence of CYP2C19*2 genotype, Concomitant administration of PPIs reduces the effects of clopidogrel. Clopidogrel is a prodrug, which needs to be activated by the metabolism CYP2C19 and CYP3A4 are involved in the metabolic activation of the drug Pharmacogenetics plays an important role in the metabolism of clopidogrel Genetic polymorphisms of the cups are seen which involve metabolic activation of clopidogrel mainly by CYP2C19 and also by CYP3A4 So, there is wide inter-individual variability in drug activation

questions.text: What is the mechanism of action of streptokinase?

options.label: A
options.text: It activates the conversion of fibrin to fibrin-split products

options.label: B
options.text: It activates the conversion of plasminogen to plasmin

options.label: C
options.text: It inhibits the conversion of prothrombin to thrombin

options.label: D
options.text: It inhibits the conversion of fibrinogen to fibrin

questions.correct_answer: B. It activates the conversion of plasminogen to plasmin
questions.explanation:
Solution:

It activates the conversion of plasminogen to plasmin

Highyeild:

Streptokinase is a bacterial product and forms a stable complex with plasminogen The resulting conformational change allows for the formation of free plasmin, the active fibrinolytic enzyme. It is given as a loading dose of 1 lakh units followed by a maintenance dose of 60,000. It is acute myocardial infarction. Side effects include hypotension of variable degrees seen in most patients and bleeding episodes in serious patients. Repeat use of the drug might reduce the efficacy of the drug in patients with past streptococcal infections, and the effect of the drug could be reduced.
